dmca.title: NOTIFICATION OF COPYRIGHT INFRINGEMENT credmax.com
dmca.body:
________________________________

From: Brent Seeber [mailto:backweb@twcny.rr.com] 
Sent: Saturday, May 05, 2007 12:02 PM
To: Copyright
Subject: NOTIFICATION OF COPYRIGHT INFRINGEMENT credmax.com

 

NOTICE OF COPYRIGHT INFRINGEMENT UNDER THE DIGITAL MILLENIUM COPYRIGHT
ACT 

I, Brent Seeber, Director of BackWeb, Inc., do solemnly swear, under
penalty of perjury, the following information is accurate, true and
complete to the best of my knowledge and belief:

You are hosting a site that is infringing our copyright protected
content.  Our site is DebtSteps.com.  Your client
has copied sections of the page noted below without permission.  



The DMCA provides that a valid claim must include the following:

 Item 1.  Identification of the copyrighted work(s) claimed to have been
infringed;

 http://www.debtsteps.com/credit-repair.html
Our copyright protected content has been on our site since at least
January 19, 2004
according to Archive.org, well before your client's domain registration
in 2006.

The content from our page:

you have three options when it comes to repairing your credit ... 

*        hire someone, preferably an attorney who knows the credit laws;

*        use a combination of the two ... an online service that provides
tools and counseling to help you with the process.

*        do-it-yourself using a good quality guide and your 3-in-1 credit
report [Highly Recommended]

Whichever way you decide to go, here are just a few tips to keep you on
track: 

*        Don't fall for scams that tell you to create a new credit file
... that's credit fraud if you do it, and can make you subject to legal
repercussions; 

*        Do read the
<http://debtsteps.com/cgi-bin/site.pl?url=http://www.ftc.gov/os/statutes
/fcra.htm> Fair Credit Reporting Act
<http://debtsteps.com/cgi-bin/site.pl?url=http://www.ftc.gov/os/statutes
/fcra.htm>  so you have an idea of your rights while you go through the
credit repair process; 

*        Get yourself organized and committed to the process, there is no
overnight fix; 

*        If you use an online service, you want to know what the fees
will be, monthly or "as you go" is best, and you want to be able to
cancel at anytime; 

*        Always act in a cooperative and professional manner when dealing
with creditors or collection agencies; 

*        Don't make threats, however subtle, if you can't back them up. 

Deciding whether to hire a credit repair firm, or doing it yourself,
depends a lot on your willingness to work, as well as your ability to be
organized and follow through on the process.

 

Item 2.  Identification of the material claimed to infringe the
copyright(s), and enough information for the receiver to locate it;

http://www.credmax.com/crepair.html
<http://www.creditrepairtrix.com/crepair.htm> 

the infringing content on your client's page:

you have three options when it comes to repairing your credit ... 

*        hire someone, preferably an attorney who knows the credit laws;

*        use a combination of the two ... an online service that provides
tools and counseling to help you with the process.

*        do-it-yourself using a good quality guide and your 3-in-1 credit
report [Highly Recommended]

Whichever way you decide to go, here are just a few tips to keep you on
track: 

*        Don't fall for scams that tell you to create a new credit file
... that's credit fraud if you do it, and can make you subject to legal
repercussions; 

*        Do read the
<http://debtsteps.com/cgi-bin/site.pl?url=http://www.ftc.gov/os/statutes
/fcra.htm> Fair Credit Reporting Act
<http://debtsteps.com/cgi-bin/site.pl?url=http://www.ftc.gov/os/statutes
/fcra.htm>  so you have an idea of your rights while you go through the
credit repair process; 

*        Get yourself organized and committed to the process, there is no
overnight fix; 

*        If you use an online service, you want to know what the fees
will be, monthly or "as you go" is best, and you want to be able to
cancel at anytime; 

*        Always act in a cooperative and professional manner when dealing
with creditors or collection agencies; 

*        Don't make threats, however subtle, if you can't back them up. 

Deciding whether to hire a credit repair firm, or doing it yourself,
depends a lot on your willingness to work, as well as your ability to be
organized and follow through on the process.

 

Item 3.  The Claimant's name, address, and telephone number(s); 

 

Brent Seeber, Director

BackWeb, Inc., Owner of DebtSteps.com

Email:  backweb@twcny.rr.com

805B CR 34

Potsdam NY USA 13676

Tel:  315-261-4236

 

Item 4.  Contact information for the infringing party:  

Registrant:
   Malcolm Kennedy
   10917 Carver Pond Rd
   Charlotte, North Carolina 28269
   United States
 
      Domain Name: CREDMAX.COM
      Created on: 26-Jan-06
      Expires on: 26-Jan-08
      Last Updated on: 07-Feb-07
 
   Administrative Contact:
      Kennedy, Malcolm  mac081603@yahoo.com
      10917 Carver Pond Rd
      Charlotte, North Carolina 28269
      United States
      (704) 491-2464

Item 5.   A statement that the Complaining Party has a good faith belief
that use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized
by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law; as follows: 

I, being the Director of BackWeb, Inc., owner of DebtSteps.com and
originator of the majority of content, the Complaining Party, have a
good faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of
is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law and know
the disputed material is not authorized by me, or the domain owner, to
be posted on the infringing site in any form. 

 
Item 6.  A statement, under penalty of perjury, that the information in
the notification of copyright infringement is accurate and that the
Claimant is authorized to act on behalf of the copyright owner, as
follows:

 
The information provided here, known as the NOTIFICATION OF COPYRIGHT
INFRINGEMENT, is accurate and true, and that I am authorized to act on
behalf of the copyright owner, BackWeb, Inc.


Please remove the infringing content and notify me when this is done.



 

Signed:
Brent Seeber, Director
BackWeb, Inc.
Owner of DebtSteps.com
